alert.note: Alert for Corson; Dewey (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Extreme Fire Danger issued November 02 at 1:51AM MDT by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: .DISCUSSION... Already breezy and mild conditions to start the day will turn warm and windy rather quickly late this morning. Temperatures will top out anywhere from mid 70s to about 80, with afternoon humidly ranging anywhere from 10 percent west river to 40 percent across the Sisseton hills and western Minnesota. These conditions combined will generate erratic fire behavior through much of the day. Additionally, a cold front passing through overnight will result in a dramatic wind shift as it proceeds from northwest to southeast. Little moisture is expected with this system, though over the next few days expect cooler temperatures and higher humidity. ...EXTREME FIRE DANGER... Extreme weather conditions and very low moisture content of grasses, and other dry organic material on the ground, indicate that critical burning conditions exist. All fires have the potential to become large and spread quickly becoming erratic with extreme behavioral characteristics. The outlook for Thursday afternoon...The grassland fire danger index will reach the high to very high category.
